title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Widespread Humanitarian Crisis in Afghanistan and the Potential for a Deepening Economic Collapse in Afghanistan
summary: The President has continued the national emergency concerning Afghanistan for another year, citing the ongoing widespread humanitarian crisis and the potential for economic collapse. This emergency, initially declared on February 11, 2022, under Executive Order 14064, is deemed an unusual and extraordinary threat to U.S. national security and foreign policy. The preservation of certain property of Da Afghanistan Bank (DAB) held in the United States is considered crucial for addressing the emergency and supporting the welfare of the Afghan people, especially in light of legal claims against DAB property.
